member.name: T:Au.Types.WIArea
member.summary: Defines the search area for and similar functions.
member.remarks: It can be a window/control, accessible object, another image or a rectangle in screen. Also allows to specify a rectangle in it, which makes the search area smaller and the function faster. Has implicit conversions from AWnd, AAcc, Bitmap, RECT (rectangle in screen), tuple (AWnd, RECT), tuple (Acc, RECT). Example: AWinImage.Find((w, (left, top, width, height)), image);.

member.name: T:Au.Types.WIImage
member.summary: Image(s) or color(s) for and similar functions.
member.remarks:
Has implicit conversions from: - string - path of .png or .bmp file. If not full path, uses . - string that starts with "resources/" or has prefix "resource:" - resource name; see . - string with prefix "image:" - Base64-encoded .png image embedded in script text.
Can be created with dialog "Find image or color in window" or with function Au.Controls.ImageUtil.ImageToString (in Au.Controls.dll). - , int in 0xRRGGBB color format, Color - color. Alpha isn't used. - - image object. - WIImage[] - multiple images or/and colors. Action - find any. To create a different action can be used callback function (parameter also).
Icons are not supported directly; you can use to get icon and convert to bitmap.

member.name: P:Au.Types.WIImage.Value
member.summary: Gets the raw value stored in this variable. Can be string, Bitmap, ColorInt, WIImage[], null.

member.name: T:Au.Types.WIFlags
member.summary: Flags for and similar functions.

member.name: F:Au.Types.WIFlags.WindowDC
member.summary: Get pixels from the device context (DC) of the window client area, not from screen DC. Usually much faster. Can get pixels from window parts that are covered by other windows or offscreen. But not from hidden and minimized windows. Does not work on Windows 7 if Aero theme is turned off. Then this flag is ignored. Cannot find images in some windows (including Windows Store apps), and in some window parts (glass). All pixels captured from these windows/parts are black. If the window is DPI-scaled, the image must be captured from its non-scaled version.

member.name: F:Au.Types.WIFlags.PrintWindow
member.summary: Use API PrintWindow to get window pixels. Like WindowDC, works with background windows, etc. Differences: - On Windows 8.1 and later works with all windows and all window parts. - Works without Aero theme too. - Slower than with WindowDC, although usually faster than without these flags. - Some windows may flicker. - Does not work with windows of higher UAC integrity level. Then this flag is ignored.

member.summary: If used list of images, search for other images. Don't search for more instances of current image. If not found, let Find return null; let Wait continue waiting; but if a Find...Return value used previously, return that result.

member.name: T:Au.Types.RXMatch
member.summary: Regular expression match info. Used with class functions and String extension methods like .
member.remarks: Contains info about a regular expression match found in the subject string: index, length, substring, etc. Also contains an array of group matches, as . Groups are regular expression parts enclosed in (), except (?...). Group matches can be accessed like array elements. Group 0 is whole match. Group 1 is the first group. See examples.

member.name: P:Au.Types.RXMatch.GroupCountPlusOne
member.summary: The number of groups in the regular expression, + 1 for the whole match.

member.summary: Start offset of the match in the subject string. The same as that of group 0.

member.name: P:Au.Types.RXMatch.End
member.summary: + . The same as that of group 0.

member.name: P:Au.Types.RXMatch.Length
member.summary: Length of the match in the subject string. The same as that of group 0.

member.name: P:Au.Types.RXMatch.Value
member.summary: The match (substring) in the subject string. The same as that of group 0.

member.name: P:Au.Types.RXMatch.Subject
member.summary: The subject string in which this match was found.

member.name: M:Au.Types.RXMatch.ToString
member.summary: Returns .

member.name: P:Au.Types.RXMatch.StartNoK
member.summary: Start offset of whole match regardless of \K. When the regular expression contains \K, this is less than .

member.name: P:Au.Types.RXMatch.Mark
member.summary: The name of a found mark, or null. Marks can be inserted in regular expression pattern like (*MARK:name) or (*:name). After a full successful match, it is the last mark encountered on the matching path through the pattern. After a "no match" or a partial match, it is the last encountered mark. For example, consider this pattern: "^(*MARK:A)((*MARK:B)a|b)c". When it matches "bc", the mark is A. The B mark is "seen" in the first branch of the group, but it is not on the matching path. On the other hand, when this pattern fails to match "bx", the mark is B.

member.name: P:Au.Types.RXMatch.Exists
member.summary: Gets the return value of the call. Can be false only when the function returned false but a mark is available (see ). Otherwise, when the function returns flase, it returns null instead of a RXMatch object. When false, all properties except Exists and Mark have undefined values or throw exception.

member.name: P:Au.Types.RXMatch.IsPartial
member.summary: Returns true if this match is partial. Partial match is possible if used a PARTIAL_ flag.

member.name: P:Au.Types.RXMatch.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets group info. Index 0 is whole match. Index 1 is the first group.
member.param: 1-based group index, or 0 for whole match.

member.name: P:Au.Types.RXMatch.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets group info of a named group.
member.param: Group name. In regular expression, to set name of group (text), use (?<NAME>text).
member.remarks: If more than 1 group have this name, prefers the first group that matched ( is true).

member.summary: Finds a named group and returns its 1-based index. Returns -1 if not found.
member.param: Group name. In regular expression, to set name of group (text), use (?<NAME>text).
member.remarks: If more than 1 group have this name, prefers the first group that matched ( is true).

member.summary: Finds a named group and returns its 1-based index. Returns -1 if not found.
member.param: Group name. In regular expression, to set name of group (text), use (?<NAME>text).
Receives true if more than 1 group have this name.
member.remarks: If more than 1 group have this name, prefers the first group that matched ( is true).

member.name: M:Au.Types.RXMatch.ExpandReplacement(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the expanded version of the specified replacement pattern.
member.param: Replacement pattern. Can consist of any combination of literal text and substitutions like $1. Supports .NET regular expression substitution syntax. See . Also: replaces $* with the name of the last encountered mark; replaces ${+func} with the return value of a function registered with .
member.remarks: Works like . See also: .

member.name: T:Au.Types.RXGroup
member.summary: Regular expression group match info. Used with , and some String extension methods.
member.remarks:
Groups are regular expression parts enclosed in (). Except non-capturing parts, like (?:...) and (?options). A RXGroup variable contains info about a group found in the subject string: index, length, substring.
Some groups specified in regular expression may not exist in the subject string even if it matches the regular expression. For example, regular expression "A(\d+)?B" matches string "AB", but group (\d+) does not exist. Then is false, -1, 0, null.
When a group matches multiple times, the RXGroup variable contains only the last instance. For example, if subject is "begin 12 345 67 end" and regular expression is (\d+ )+, value of group 1 is "67". If you need all instances ("12", "345", "67"), instead use .NET and . Also you can get all instances with .
Examples and more info: , .

member.name: P:Au.Types.RXGroup.Start
member.summary: Start offset of the group match in the subject string.

member.name: P:Au.Types.RXGroup.Length
member.summary: Length of the group match in the subject string.

member.name: P:Au.Types.RXGroup.Value
member.summary: String value of the group match in the subject string.

member.name: P:Au.Types.RXGroup.Exists
member.summary: Returns true if the group exists in the subject string, false if does not exist. More info in topic. Example in topic.
member.remarks: Other ways to detect it: if a group does not exist, its Index is -1 and Value is null.

member.summary: Returns .

member.name: T:Au.Types.RXCalloutData
member.summary: Managed version of PCRE API struct pcre2_callout_block. When you set , your callout function's parameter is of this type. More info in PCRE help topic pcre2callout. Most properties are pcre2_callout_block fields as documented in PCRE help. Other properties and methods are easier/safer versions of unsafe fields like offset_vector.

member.name: P:Au.Types.RXCalloutData.Result
member.summary: Sets the return value of the callout function, as documented in PCRE help topic pcre2callout. Default 0. If 1, matching fails at the current point, but the testing of other matching possibilities goes ahead, just as if a lookahead assertion had failed. If -1 (PCRE2_ERROR_NOMATCH), the match function returns false (no match). Values less tan -2 are PCRE error codes and cause exception.

member.name: P:Au.Types.RXCalloutData.callout_number
member.summary: Callout number, eg 5 for "(?C5)". More info in PCRE help topic pcre2callout.

member.name: P:Au.Types.RXCalloutData.capture_top
member.summary: One more than the number of the highest numbered captured group so far. More info in PCRE help topic pcre2callout.

member.name: P:Au.Types.RXCalloutData.capture_last
member.summary: The number of the most recently captured group. More info in PCRE help topic pcre2callout.

member.name: P:Au.Types.RXCalloutData.callout_flags
member.summary: Flags. 1 PCRE2_CALLOUT_STARTMATCH, 2 PCRE2_CALLOUT_BACKTRACK. More info in PCRE help topic pcre2callout.

member.name: P:Au.Types.RXCalloutData.start_match
member.summary: The offset within the subject string at which the current match attempt started. But depends on \K etc. More info in PCRE help topic pcre2callout.

member.name: P:Au.Types.RXCalloutData.current_position
member.summary: The current offset within the subject string.

member.name: P:Au.Types.RXCalloutData.pattern_position
member.summary: The offset in the regular expression to the next item to be matched.

member.name: P:Au.Types.RXCalloutData.next_item_length
member.summary: The length of the next item to be processed in the regular expression. More info in PCRE help topic pcre2callout.

member.name: P:Au.Types.RXCalloutData.callout_string_offset
member.summary: The callout string offset in the regular expression. Used with callouts like "(?C'calloutString')". More info in PCRE help topic pcre2callout.

member.name: P:Au.Types.RXCalloutData.callout_string
member.summary: The callout string, eg "xyz" for "(?C'xyz')". More info in PCRE help topic pcre2callout.

member.name: P:Au.Types.RXCalloutData.mark
member.summary: The most recently passed (*MARK), (*PRUNE), or (*THEN) item in the match, or null if no such items have been passed. More info in PCRE help topic pcre2callout.

member.name: T:Au.Types.RXFlags
member.summary: Flags for constructor. Documented in PCRE help topic pcre2api.
member.remarks:
Many options also can be specified in regular expression (RE): - These can be anywhere in RE: (?i) CASELESS, (?m) MULTILINE, (?s) DOTALL, (?n) NO_AUTO_CAPTURE, (?x) EXTENDED, (?xx) EXTENDED_MORE, (?J) DUPNAMES, (?U) UNGREEDY. Can be multiple, like (?ms). Can be unset, like (?-i). RE "\Qtext\E" is like RE "text" with flag LITERAL. - Instead of ANCHORED can be used \A or \G at the start of RE. Or ^, except in multiline mode. - Instead of ENDANCHORED can be used \z at the end of RE. Or $, except in multiline mode. - Flag UTF is implicitly added if RE contains non-ASCII characters and there is no flag NEVER_UTF. - These must be at the very start and are named like flags: (*UTF), (*UCP), (*NOTEMPTY), (*NOTEMPTY_ATSTART), (*NO_AUTO_POSSESS), (*NO_DOTSTAR_ANCHOR), (*NO_START_OPT). - More info in PCRE syntax reference.
Some of RXFlags flags also exist in . You can set them either when calling ARegex constructor or when calling ARegex functions that have parameter more. You can use different flags for each function call with the same ARegex variable.

member.name: F:Au.Types.RXFlags.UTF
member.summary: Fully support Unicode text (case-insensitivity etc). More info in PCRE documentation topic pcre2unicode. This flag is implicitly added if regular expression contains non-ASCII characters and there is no flag NEVER_UTF.

member.name: T:Au.Types.RXMatchFlags
member.summary: Flags for and other class functions. Documented in PCRE help topic pcre2api.
member.remarks: These flags also exist in (ARegex constructor flags). You can set them either when calling constructor or when calling other functions.

member.name: T:Au.ALastError
member.summary: Gets, sets or clears the last error code of Windows API. Gets error text.
member.remarks:
Many Windows API functions, when failed, set an error code. Code 0 means no error. It is stored in an internal thread-specific int variable. But only if the API declaration's DllImport attribute has SetLastError = true.
Some functions of this library simply call these API functions and don't throw exception when API fail. For example, most propery-get functions. When failed, they return false/0/null/empty. Then you can use to get the error code or to get error text.
Most of functions set error code only when failed, and don't clear the old error code when succeeded. Therefore may need to call before.
Windows API error code definitions and documentation are not included in this library. You can look for them in API function documentation on the internet.

member.name: M:Au.ALastError.Clear
member.summary: Calls API SetLastError(0), which clears the Windows API last error code of this thread.
member.remarks: Need it before calling some functions if you want to use or . The same as ALastError.Code = 0;.

member.name: P:Au.ALastError.Code
member.summary: Gets () or sets (API SetLastError) the Windows API last error code of this thread.

member.name: P:Au.ALastError.Message
member.summary: Gets the text message of the Windows API last error code of this thread. Returns null if the code is 0.
member.remarks: The string always ends with ".".

member.name: M:Au.ALastError.MessageFor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the text message of a Windows API error code. Returns null if errorCode is 0.
member.remarks: The string always ends with ".".

member.name: T:Au.AOpt
member.summary: Options for some functions of this library.
member.remarks:
Some frequently used static functions of this library have some options (settings). For example allows to change speed, text sending method, etc. Passing options as parameters in each call usually isn't what you want to do in automation scripts. Instead you can set options using static properties. This class contains several groups of options for functions of various classes. See examples.
There are two sets of identical or similar options - in class AOpt and in class : - AOpt - thread-static options (each thread has its own instance). Functions of this library use them. You can change or change-restore them anywhere in script. Initial options are automatically copied from AOpt.Static when that group of options (Key, Mouse, etc) is used first time in that thread (explicitly or by library functions). - AOpt.Static - static options. Contains initial property values for AOpt. Normally you change them when script starts. Don't change later, it's not thread-safe.

member.name: P:Au.AOpt.Key
member.summary: Options for keyboard and clipboard functions (classes , and functions that use them).
member.remarks: Each thread has its own AOpt.Key instance. It inherits options from . Also can be used when creating instances. See the second example.

member.name: P:Au.AOpt.Mouse
member.summary: Options for mouse functions (class and functions that use it).
member.remarks: Each thread has its own AOpt.Mouse instance. It inherits options from .

example.code: AOpt.Mouse.ClickSpeed = 100; AMouse.Click();

member.name: P:Au.AOpt.WaitFor
member.summary: Options for 'wait for' functions.
member.remarks: Each thread has its own AOpt.WaitFor instance. There is no AOpt.Static.WaitFor. Most 'wait for' functions of this library use these options. Functions of .NET classes don't.

member.name: P:Au.AOpt.Warnings
member.summary: Options for showing run-time warnings and other info that can be useful to find problems in code at run time.
member.remarks: Each thread has its own AOpt.Warnings instance. It inherits options from .

member.name: T:Au.AOpt.Static
member.summary: Default properties of a thread.
member.remarks: You can change these options at the start of your script/program. Don't change later.

member.name: P:Au.AOpt.Static.Key
member.summary: Default option values for of a thread.
member.remarks: Also can be used when creating instances. See the second example.
member.example:
AOpt.Static.Key.KeySpeed = 10; ... AKeys.Key("Tab Ctrl+V"); //uses AOpt.Key, which is implicitly copied from AOpt.Static.Key
Use an AKeys instance.
var k = new AKeys(AOpt.Static.Key); //create new AKeys instance and copy options from AOpt.Static.Key to it k.Options.KeySpeed = 100; //changes option of k k.Add("Tab Ctrl+V").Send(); //uses options of k

member.name: P:Au.AOpt.Static.Mouse
member.summary: Default option values for of a thread.

member.name: P:Au.AOpt.Static.Warnings
member.summary: Default option values for of a thread.

example.code: AOpt.Static.Warnings.Verbose = false;

member.name: T:Au.AOpt.Scope
member.summary: Creates temporary scopes for options. Example: using(AOpt.Scope.Key()) { AOpt.Key.KeySpeed=5; ... }.

member.summary: Creates temporary scope for options. See example.
member.param: If true (default), inherit current options. If false, inherit default options ().

member.summary: Creates temporary scope for options. See example.
member.param: If true (default), inherit current options. If false, inherit default options ().

member.summary: Gets API result as string, or allocates bigger buffer if old buffer was too small. This function can be used when T is char.

Set s = this string if buffer too small or r < 1 or if the retrieved string == this string (avoid creating new string).

member.name: M:Au.Util.ADisableFsRedirection.Disable
member.summary: If , calls API Wow64DisableWow64FsRedirection, which disables file system redirection. The caller can call this without checking OS and process bitness. member.name: T:Au.Util.ADpi
member.summary: Functions for high-DPI screen support.
member.remarks:
To find DPI % on Windows 10: Settings -> System -> Display -> Scale and layout. If not 100%, it means high DPI. On older Windows versions it is in Control Panel -> Display.
This program must be per-monitor-DPI-aware. Alse the results are undefined.

member.name: P:Au.Util.ADpi.System
member.summary: Gets DPI of the primary screen at the time this process started.

member.name: M:Au.Util.ADpi.OfWindow(Au.AWnd,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets DPI of a window.
member.param: Top-level window or control. Can belong to any process.

If true, the function gets DPI for which the window is (or should be) scaled, either by the program or by the OS; it depends on window's current screen DPI. If false (default), gets DPI used internally by the window's program; it does not depend on whether the window is OS-scaled; it never changes for that window instance.
member.remarks:
If ofScreen is false (default), the result depends on the DPI awareness of the window: - per-monitor-DPI-aware - usually DPI of windows's screen. - system aware - system DPI (DPI of primary screen). - unaware - 96.
To get window's internal DPI, on Windows 10 1607 and later uses API GetDpiForWindow. On Windows 8.1 and early Windows 10, if is true, uses API GetDpiForMonitor. Older Windows versions don't support per-monitor DPI.
Returns the system DPI () if fails or if not supported on this Windows version (see ).
On Windows 7 and 8.0 always returns the system DPI, because of lack of Windows API; it is always correct only if ofScreen is true.

member.name: M:Au.Util.ADpi.OfWindow(System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Returns OfWindow(w.Hwnd()).

member.name: M:Au.Util.ADpi.OfWindow(System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Returns OfWindow(w.Hwnd()).

member.name: M:Au.Util.ADpi.OfScreen(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Gets DPI of a screen. Returns if fails or if not supported on this Windows version (see ).
member.remarks: Uses API GetDpiForMonitor.

member.name: P:Au.Util.ADpi.SupportPMOnWin8_1
member.summary: If true, and will support per-monitor DPI on Windows 8.1 and later. If false (default) - on Windows 10 1607 and later; on 8.1 will always return .
member.remarks: This is a per-thread property. You can change/restore it before/after calling these functions. Before Windows 10 1607 it is difficult to support per-monitor DPI because of lack of API and OS/.NET support.

member.summary: Can be used to temporarily change thread's DPI awareness context with API SetThreadDpiAwarenessContext. Does nothing if the API is unavailable (added in Windows 10 version 1607).
member.remarks: Programs that use this library should use manifest with dpiAwareness = PerMonitorV2 and dpiAware = True/PM. Then default DPI awareness context is DPI_AWARENESS_CONTEXT_PER_MONITOR_AWARE_V2.

member.summary: Gets image from memory cache or file or resource.
member.param: File path, or resource path that starts with "resources/" or has prefix "resource:", etc. See isImage parameter.
DPI of window that will display the image.
true - load image from xaml/png/etc file, resource or string with or . false - get file icon with . null (default) - call to determine whether it is image.

If not null, if the image is still not in cache, Get returns null and loads it asynchronously in other thread. When loaded, calls asyncCompletion in this thread. Can be used to avoid slow startup when need to get many file icons. This thread must dispatch messages, else the callback will not be called. Used only for icons, not for images.
Something to pass to the asyncCompletion callback function. The function is called once for a unique asyncCompletion/acData.
Action to call when fails to load image. If null, calls . Parameters are image source string and exception.

member.name: M:Au.Util.AMath.MakeLparam(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Creates uint by placing (ushort)loWord in bits 1-16 and (ushort)hiWord in bits 17-32. Returns it as nint, ready to use with Windows message API as lParam or wParam or return value. Like C macro MAKELONG, MAKEWPARAM, MAKELPARAM, MAKELRESULT.

member.name: M:Au.Util.AMath.MakeLparam(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates uint by placing (ushort)loWord in bits 1-16 and (ushort)hiWord in bits 17-32. Returns it as nint, ready to use with Windows message API as lParam or wParam or return value. Like C macro MAKELONG, MAKEWPARAM, MAKELPARAM, MAKELRESULT.

member.name: M:Au.Util.AMath.MakeLparam(Au.Types.POINT)
member.summary: Creates uint by placing (ushort)p.x in bits 1-16 and (ushort)p.y in bits 17-32. Returns it as nint, ready to use with Windows message API as lParam or wParam or return value. Like C macro MAKELONG, MAKEWPARAM, MAKELPARAM, MAKELRESULT.

member.name: M:Au.Util.AMath.MakeWord(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Creates ushort by placing (byte)loByte in bits 1-8 and (byte)hiByte in bits 9-16. Like C macro MAKEWORD.

member.name: M:Au.Util.AMath.MakeWord(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates ushort by placing (byte)loByte in bits 1-8 and (byte)hiByte in bits 9-16. Like C macro MAKEWORD.

member.name: M:Au.Util.AMath.LoWord(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Gets bits 1-16 as ushort. Like C macro LOWORD.
member.remarks: The parameter is interpreted as uint. The parameter type nint allows to avoid explicit cast from int and IntPtr (and avoid OverflowException).

member.name: M:Au.Util.AMath.HiWord(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Gets bits 17-32 as ushort. Like C macro HIWORD.
member.remarks: The parameter is interpreted as uint. The parameter type nint allows to avoid explicit cast from int and IntPtr (and avoid OverflowException).

member.name: M:Au.Util.AMath.LoShort(System.IntPtr)

Alignment. Must be a power of two (2, 4, 8, 16...).

member.name: M:Au.Util.AMath.AlignUp(System.Int32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: If value is divisible by alignment, returns value. Else returns nearest bigger number that is divisible by alignment.

Alignment. Must be a power of two (2, 4, 8, 16...).

example.code: for (int i = 0; i <= 20; i++) AOutput.Write(i, AMath.AlignUp(i, 4));

member.summary: Allocates memory from native heap of this process using heap API. Also has more functions to work with memory: copy, move.

Set all bytes = 0.

member.summary: Reallocates a memory block to make it bigger or smaller.
member.param: Input: old memory address; if null, allocates new memory like . Output: new memory address. Unchanged if exception.
New count of elements of type T.
When size is growing, set all added bytes = 0.
member.exception: Failed. Probably count is too big.
member.remarks: Calls API HeapReAlloc or HeapAlloc. Preserves data in Math.Min(oldCount, newCount) elements of old memory (copies from old memory if need). The memory is unmanaged and will not be freed automatically. Always call when done. Call ReAlloc or if need to resize.

member.name: M:Au.Util.ARecording.MouseToString(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.UInt32},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts multiple recorded mouse movements to string for .
member.param: List of x y distances from previous. The first distance is from mouse position before the first movement; at run time it will be distance from . To create uint value from distance dx dy use and cast to uint.

recorded also contains sleep times (milliseconds) alternating with distances. It must start with a sleep time. Example: {time1, dist1, time2, dist2}. Another example: {time1, dist1, time2, dist2, time3}. This is invalid: {dist1, time1, dist2, time2}.

member.name: T:Au.Util.ARegisteredHotkey
member.summary: Registers a hotkey using API RegisterHotKey. Unregisters when disposing.
member.remarks:
Can be used as a lightweight alternative to hotkey triggers.
The variable must be disposed, either explicitly (call Dispose or Unregister) or with the 'using' pattern.

member.name: M:Au.Util.ARegisteredHotkey.Register(System.Int32,Au.Types.KHotkey,Au.Types.AnyWnd)
member.summary: Registers a hotkey using API RegisterHotKey. Returns false if fails. Supports .
member.param: Hotkey id. Must be 0 to 0xBFFF or value returned by API GlobalAddAtom. It will be wParam of the WM_HOTKEY message.
Hotkey. Can be: string like "Ctrl+Shift+Alt+Win+K", tuple (KMod, KKey), enum KKey, enum Keys, struct KHotkey.
Window/form that will receive the WM_HOTKEY message. Must be of this thread. If default, the message must be retrieved in the message loop of this thread.
member.exception: This variable already registered a hotkey.
member.remarks: Fails if the hotkey is currently registered by this or another application or used by Windows. Also if F12. Most single-key and Shift+key hotkeys don't work when the active window has higher UAC integrity level (eg admin) than this process. Media keys may work. A single variable cannot register multiple hotkeys simultaneously. Use multiple variables, for example array.
member.example: See .

member.name: M:Au.Util.ARegisteredHotkey.Unregister
member.summary: Unregisters the hotkey.
member.remarks: Called implicitly when disposing this variable. Must be called from the same thread as when registering, and the window must be still alive. If fails, calls .

member.name: M:Au.Util.ARegisteredHotkey.Dispose
member.summary: Calls .

member.name: F:Au.Util.ARegisteredHotkey.WM_HOTKEY
member.summary: This message is posted to the window or to the thread's message loop. More info: WM_HOTKEY.

member.name: T:Au.Util.AResources
member.summary: Gets managed resources from a .NET assembly.
member.remarks: Internally uses . Uses . Loads resources from manifest resource "AssemblyName.g.resources". To add such resource files in Visual Studio, set file build action = Resource. Don't use .resx files and the Resources page in Project Properties. By default loads resources from the app entry assembly. In script with role miniProgram - from the script's assembly. To specify other loaded assembly, use name like "<AssemblyName>file.txt". Does not use caching. Creates new object even when loading the resource not the first time.

member.param: Can be resource name like "file.txt" or "sub/file.txt" or "<LoadedAssemblyName>file.txt". Can have prefix "resource:".
member.exception: The resource is of different type. This function does not convert.
Other exceptions that may be thrown by used .NET functions.

member.name: T:Au.Util.ASettings
member.summary: Base of classes that load/save various settings from/to a JSON file.
member.remarks:
Derived classes must provide public get/set properties. - 'get' usually just return a field. - 'set' must call a SetX method provided by this base class. Then changes will be automatically lazily saved.
All functions are thread-safe, except when setting/getting non-atomic struct types (containing multiple fields, decimal, also long in 32-bit process).

member.name: M:Au.Util.ASettings.Load``1(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Loads JSON file and deserializes to new object of type T. Sets to save automatically whenever a property changed. Returns new empty object if file does not exist or failed to load or parse (invalid JSON) or useDefault true. If failed, writes error info to the output.
member.param: Full path of .json file. If null, does not load and will not save.
Use default settings, don't load from file. Delete file if exists.

member.name: M:Au.Util.ASettings.Dispose
member.summary: Call this when finished using the settings. Saves now if need, and stops autosaving. Don't need to call if the settings are used until process exit.

member.name: M:Au.Util.ASettings.SaveIfNeed
member.summary: Saves now if need. Don't need to call explicitly. Autosaving is every 2 s, also on process exit and Dispose.

member.name: M:Au.Util.ASettings.SaveLater
member.summary: Call this when changed an array element etc directly without assigning the array etc to a property. Else changes may be not saved.

member.name: P:Au.Util.ASettings.LoadedFile
member.summary: true if settings were loaded from file.
member.remarks: Returns false if Load did not find the file (the settings were not saved) or failed to load/parse or parameter useDefault = true or parameter file = null.

member.name: P:Au.Util.ASettings.Modified
member.summary: true if settings were loaded from file (see ) or modified later.

member.name: M:Au.Util.ASettings.Set``1(``0@,``0)
member.summary: Sets a property value and will save later if need. If !_loaded, sets prop = value. Else if value != prop, sets prop = value and _save = true. To compare, uses ; it compares value types and string by value, but most other reference types (eg arrays) by reference.
member.param: Property.
New value.

member.name: M:Au.Util.ASettings.Set``1(``0@,``0,System.Func{``0,``0,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Sets a property value and will save later if need. If !_loaded, sets prop = value. Else if value != prop (comparer returns false), sets prop = value and _save = true.
member.param: Property.
New value.
Called by this method to compare prop and value. Return true if equal.

member.name: T:Au.Util.ArrayBuilder_`1
member.summary: Like List or StringBuilder, used as a temporary variable-size array to create final fixed-size array. To avoid much garbage (and many reallocations when growing), uses native memory heap. See . Must be explicitly disposed to free the native memory. Does not have a finalizer because is struct (to avoid garbage). Does not support reference types. Does not call T.Dispose.

member.name: P:Au.Util.ArrayBuilder_`1.Ptr
member.summary: Gets array memory address (address of element 0).

member.name: P:Au.Util.ArrayBuilder_`1.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of elements.

member.summary: Gets the number of bytes in the array (Count*sizeof(T)).

member.name: P:Au.Util.ArrayBuilder_`1.Capacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the total number of elements (not bytes) the internal memory can hold without resizing.
member.exception: (the 'set' function) value less than Count. Instead use ReAlloc or Free.

member.name: M:Au.Util.ArrayBuilder_`1.Alloc(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allocates count elements. Sets Count=count. Frees previously allocated memory. Returns memory address (address of element 0).
member.param: Element count.
Set all bytes = 0. If false, the memory is uninitialized, ie random byte values. Default true. Slower when true.
Set Capacity = count. If false, allocates more if count is less thah the minimal capacity for this type.

member.name: M:Au.Util.ArrayBuilder_`1.ReAlloc(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds or removes elements at the end. Sets Count=count. Preserves Math.Min(Count, count) existing elements. Returns memory address (address of element 0).
member.param: New element count.
Set all added bytes = 0. If false, the added memory is uninitialized, ie random byte values. Default true. Slower when true.
Set Capacity = count. If false, allocates more if count is less thah the minimal capacity for this type.
member.remarks: The new memory usually is at a new location. The preserved elements are copied there. Sets Count=count. To allocate more memory without changing Count, change Capacity instead.

member.name: M:Au.Util.ArrayBuilder_`1.Free
member.summary: Frees memory. Sets Count and Capacity = 0.

member.name: T:Au.AFile
member.summary: Contains static functions to work with files and directories, such as copy, move, delete, find, get properties, enumerate, create directory, safe load/save, wait if locked.
member.remarks:
Also you can use .NET file system classes, such as and in System.IO namespace. In the past they were too limited and unsafe to use, for example no long paths, too many exceptions, difficult to recursively enumerate directories containing protected items. Later improved, but this class still has something they don't, for example environment variables in path, safe load/save. This class does not have low-level functions to open/read/write files.
Most functions support only full path. Most of them throw ArgumentException if passed a filename or relative path, ie in "current directory". Using current directory is unsafe. Most functions support extended-length paths (longer than 259). Such local paths should have @"\\?\" prefix, like @"\\?\C:\...". Such network path should be like @"\\?\UNC\server\share\...". See , . Many functions support long paths even without prefix.
Disk drives like @"C:\" or "C:" are directories too.

member.name: M:Au.AFile._DisableDeviceNotReadyMessageBox
member.summary: Adds SEM_FAILCRITICALERRORS to the error mode of this process, as MSDN recommends. Once in process. It is to avoid unnecessary message boxes when an API tries to access an ejected CD/DVD etc.

member.name: M:Au.AFile.GetProperties(System.String,Au.Types.FileProperties@,Au.Types.FAFlags)
member.summary: Gets file or directory attributes, size and times. Returns false if the file/directory does not exist. Calls API GetFileAttributesEx.
member.param: Full path. Supports @"\.." etc. If flag UseRawPath not used, supports environment variables (see ).
Receives properties.
member.exception: Not full path (when not used flag UseRawPath).
The file/directory exist but failed to get its properties. Not thrown if used flag DontThrow.
member.remarks: For symbolic links etc, gets properties of the link, not of its target. You can also get most of these properties with .

member.name: M:Au.AFile.GetAttributes(System.String,System.IO.FileAttributes@,Au.Types.FAFlags)
member.summary: Gets file or directory attributes. Returns false if the file/directory does not exist. Calls API GetFileAttributes.

member.name: M:Au.AFile._GetAttributes(System.String,System.IO.FileAttributes@,System.Boolean)

member.name: M:Au.AFile.Exists(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets file or directory attributes as that tells whether it exists, is directory, symbolic link, readonly, hidden, system. See examples.
member.param: Full path. Supports @"\.." etc. If useRawPath is false (default), supports environment variables (see ). Can be null.
Pass path to the API as it is, without any normalizing and full-path checking.
member.remarks: Supports . If you need exception when fails, instead call and check attribute Directory. Always use full path. If path is not full: if useRawPath is false (default), can't find the file; if useRawPath is true, searches in "current directory". For symbolic links gets attributes of the link, not target; does not care whether its target exists.

member.name: M:Au.AFile.ExistsAs_(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets file system entry type - file, directory, symbolic link, whether it exists and is accessible. Returns NotFound (0) if does not exist. Returns AccessDenied (< 0) if exists but this process cannot access it and get attributes. Calls API GetFileAttributes.
member.param: Full path. Supports @"\.." etc. If useRawPath is false (default), supports environment variables (see ). Can be null.
Pass path to the API as it is, without any normalizing and full-path checking.
member.remarks: Supports . If you need exception when fails, instead call and check attributes Directory and ReparsePoint. Always use full path. If path is not full: if useRawPath is false (default) returns NotFound; if useRawPath is true, searches in "current directory".

member.name: M:Au.AFile.SearchPath(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Finds file or directory and returns full path. Returns null if cannot be found.
member.remarks: If the path argument is full path, calls and returns normalized path if exists, null if not. Else searches in these places: 1. dirs, if used. 2. . 3. Calls API SearchPath, which searches in process directory, Windows system directories, current directory, PATH environment variable. The search order depends on API SetSearchPathMode or registry settings. 4. If path ends with ".exe", tries to get path from registry "App Paths" keys.
member.param: Full or relative path or just filename with extension. Supports network paths too.
0 or more directories where to search.

member.name: M:Au.AFile.Enumerate(System.String,Au.Types.FEFlags,System.Func{Au.Types.FEFile,System.Boolean},System.Action{System.String})
member.summary: Gets names and other info of files and subdirectories in the specified directory. Returns an enumerable collection of objects containing the info.
member.param: Full path of the directory.

Callback function. Called for each file and subdirectory. If returns false, the file/subdirectory is not included in results. Can be useful when Enumerate is called indirectly, for example by the method. If you call it directly, you can instead skip the file in your foreach loop. Example: filter: k => k.IsDirectory || k.Name.Ends(".png", true). See .

Callback function. Called when fails to get children of a subdirectory, when using flag . Receives the subdirectory path. Can call .Code and throw an exception. If does not throw, the enumeration continues as if the directory is empty. If errorHandler not used, then Enumerate throws exception. See also: flag .
member.exception: directoryPath is invalid path or not full path.
Failed to get children of directoryPath or of a subdirectory.
member.remarks:
Uses API FindFirstFile.
By default gets only direct children. Use flag to get all descendants.
The paths that this function gets are normalized, ie may not start with exact directoryPath string. Expanded environment variables (see ), "..", DOS path etc. Paths longer than have @"\\?\" prefix (see ).
For symbolic links and mounted folders, gets info of the link/folder and not of its target.
These errors are ignored: 1. Missing target directory of a symbolic link or mounted folder. 2. If used flag - access denied.
When an error is ignored, the function works as if that [sub]directory is empty; does not throw exception and does not call errorHandler.
Enumeration of a subdirectory starts immediately after the subdirectory itself is retrieved.

member.summary: Moves (changes path of) file or directory.

New full path. It is not the new parent directory. Use for it.
member.exception: path or newPath is not full path (see ).

member.remarks:
In most cases uses API MoveFileEx. It's fast, because don't need to copy files. In these cases copies/deletes: destination is on another drive; need to merge directories. When need to copy, does not copy security properties; sets default.
Creates the destination directory if does not exist (see ). If path and newPath share the same parent directory, just renames the file.

member.name: M:Au.AFile.Delete(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deletes file or directory. Does nothing if it does not exist (no exception).
member.param: Full path.

Send to the Recycle Bin. If not possible, delete anyway. Why could be not possible: 1. The file is in a removable drive (most removables don't have a recycle bin). 2. The file is too large. 3. The path is too long. 4. The Recycle Bin is not used on that drive (it can be set in the Recycle Bin Properties dialog). 5. This process is non-UI-interactive, eg a service. 6. Unknown reasons. Note: it is much slower. To delete multiple, use .
member.remarks:
If directory, also deletes all its files and subdirectories. If fails to delete some, tries to delete as many as possible. Deletes read-only files too. Does not show any message boxes etc (confirmation, error, UAC consent, progress).
Some reasons why this function can fail: 1. The file is open (in any process). Or a file in the directory is open. 2. This process does not have security permissions to access or delete the file or directory or some of its descendants. 3. The directory is (or contains) the "current directory" (in any process).

member.name: M:Au.AFile.Delete(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deletes multiple files or/and directories. The same as , but faster when using Recycle Bin.
member.param: string array, List or other collection. Full paths.

member.name: M:Au.AFile.WaitIfLocked``1(System.Func{``0},System.Int32)
member.summary: This function can be used to safely open a file that may be temporarily locked (used by another process or thread). Waits while the file is locked.
member.returns: Returns the return value of the lambda f.
member.param: Lambda that calls a function that creates, opens or opens/reads/closes a file.
Wait max this number of milliseconds. Can be (-1).
member.exception: Exceptions thrown by the called function.
member.remarks: Calls the lambda and handles IOException. If the exception indicates that the file is locked, waits and retries in loop.

member.name: M:Au.AFile.WaitIfLocked(System.Action,System.Int32)
member.exception: Exceptions thrown by the called function.

example.code:
File.WriteAllText(file, "TEXT"); //unsafe. Exception if the file is locked.
AFile.WaitIfLocked(() => File.WriteAllText(file, "TEXT")); //safe. Waits while the file is locked.

member.name: M:Au.AFile.Save(System.String,System.Action{System.String},System.Boolean,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes any data to a file in a safe way, using a callback function.
member.param: File. Must be full path. Can contain environment variables etc, see . The file can exist or not; this function overwrites it. If the directory does not exist, this function creates it.

Callback function (lambda etc) that creates/writes/closes a temporary file. Its parameter is the full path of the temporary file, which normally does not exist. May be called multiple times, because this function retries if the file is locked or if the directory does not exist (if writer throws DirectoryNotFoundException exception).
Create backup file named file + "~backup".

Directory for backup file and temporary file. If null or "" - file's directory. Can contain environment variales etc. Must be in the same drive as file. If the directory does not exist, this function creates it.
If cannot open file because it is open by another process etc, wait max this number of milliseconds. Can be (-1).
member.exception: Failed to replace file. The writer function also can thow it.
member.remarks:
The file-write functions provided by .NET and Windows API are less reliable, because: 1. Fails if the file is temporarily open by another process or thread without sharing. 2. Can corrupt file data. If this thread, process, PC or disk dies while writing, may write only part of data or just make empty file. Usually it happens when PC is turned off incorrectly.
To protect from 1, this functions waits/retries if the file is temporarily open/locked, like . To protect from 2, this function writes to a temporary file and renames/replaces the specified file using API ReplaceFile. Although not completely atomic, it ensures that file data is not corrupt; if cannot write all data, does not change existing file data. Also this function auto-creates directory if does not exist.
This function is slower. Speed can be important when saving many files.

Text encoding in file. Default is UTF-8 without BOM.

member.name: M:Au.AFile.More.LoadDll64or32Bit(System.String)
member.summary: Loads an unmanaged dll from subfolder "64" or "32" depending on whether this process is 64-bit or 32-bit.
member.param: Dll file name like "name.dll".
member.remarks:
If your program uses an unmanaged dll and can run as either 64-bit or 32-bit process, you need 2 versions of the dll - 64-bit and 32-bit. Let they live in subfolders "64" and "32" of your program folder. They must have same name. This function loads correct dll version. Then [DllImport("dll")] will use the loaded dll. Don't need two different DllImport for functions ([DllImport("dll64")] and [DllImport("dll32")]).
If the dll does not exist in these folders, this function also looks in: - subfolder "64" or "32" of folder specified in environment variable "Au.Path". For example the dll is unavailable if used in an assembly (managed dll) loaded in a nonstandard environment, eg VS forms designer or VS C# Interactive (then AFolders.ThisApp is "C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\..."). Workaround: set %Au.Path% = the main Au directory and restart Windows. - subfolder "64" or "32" of . For example the dll may be extracted there from resources.

member.name: T:Au.AFolders
member.summary: Gets known/special folder paths (Desktop, Temp, etc).
member.remarks:
Most functions return , not string. It is implicitly convertible to string. Its operator + appends a filename or relative path string, with \ separator if need. Example: string s = AFolders.Desktop + "file.txt"; //C:\Users\Name\Desktop\file.txt If a function cannot get folder path, the return value contains null string. Then the + operator would throw .
Some folders are known only on newer Windows versions or only on some computers. Some functions have a suffix like _Win8 which means that the folder is unavailable on older Windows. Some known folders, although supported and registerd, may be still not created.
Some folders are virtual, for example Control Panel. They don't have a file system path, but can be identified by a data structure called "ITEMIDLIST" or "PIDL". Functions of the nested class return it as . Functions of the nested class return it as string ":: ITEMIDLIST" that can be used with some functions of this library (of classes AFile, Pidl, AIcon) but not with .NET or native functions.
Most functions use Windows "Known Folders" API, such as SHGetKnownFolderPath. The list of Windows predefined known folders: KNOWNFOLDERID. Names of folders specific to current process have prefix This, like ThisApp.
Some paths depend on the bitness (32 or 64 bit) of the OS and this process.
32-bit Windows
System, SystemX86, SystemX64: @"C:\WINDOWS\system32"
ProgramFiles, ProgramFilesX86, ProgramFilesX64: @"C:\Program Files"
ProgramFilesCommon, ProgramFilesCommonX86, ProgramFilesCommonX64: @"C:\Program Files\Common Files"
64-bit Windows, 64-bit process
System, SystemX64: @"C:\WINDOWS\system32"
SystemX86: @"C:\WINDOWS\SysWOW64"
ProgramFiles, ProgramFilesX64: @"C:\Program Files"
ProgramFilesX86: @"C:\Program Files (x86)"
ProgramFilesCommon, ProgramFilesCommonX64: @"C:\Program Files\Common Files"
ProgramFilesCommonX86: @"C:\Program Files (x86)\Common Files"
64-bit Windows, 32-bit process
System: @"C:\WINDOWS\system32". However the OS in most cases redirects this path to @"C:\WINDOWS\SysWOW64".
SystemX86: @"C:\WINDOWS\SysWOW64"
SystemX64: @"C:\WINDOWS\Sysnative". The OS redirects it to the true @"C:\WINDOWS\system32". It is a special path, not in Explorer.
ProgramFiles, ProgramFilesX86: @"C:\Program Files (x86)"
ProgramFilesX64: @"C:\Program Files"
ProgramFilesCommon, ProgramFilesCommonX86: @"C:\Program Files (x86)\Common Files"
ProgramFilesCommonX64: @"C:\Program Files\Common Files"

member.name: M:Au.AFolders.UnexpandPath(System.String,System.String@,System.String@)

member.param: Any string. Can be null. Case-insensitive. Supports ":: ITEMIDLIST" (see ).
Receives special folder string like "AFolders.System".
Receives filename or relative path in the folder.
member.remarks: Quite slow first time in process, eg 50 ms, because gets all folder paths. Later uses cached paths.

member.name: P:Au.AIcon.DebugSpeed
member.summary: If not 0, "get icon" functions of this class will print (in editor's output) their execution time in milliseconds when it >= this value.
member.remarks: Icons are mostly used in toolbars and menus. Getting icons of some files can be slow. For example if antivirus program scans the file. Toolbars and menus that use slow icons may start with a noticeable delay. Use this property to find too slow icons. Then you can replace them with fast icons, for example .ico files.

member.name: M:Au.AIcon.IconPathFromCode_(System.Reflection.MethodInfo,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Gets icon path from code that contains string like @"c:\windows\system32\notepad.exe" or @"%AFolders.System%\notepad.exe" or URL/shell. Also supports code patterns like AFolders.System + "notepad.exe" or AFolders.Virtual.RecycleBin. Returns null if no such string/pattern.

member.name: T:Au.APath
member.summary: Contains static functions to work with file paths. Parse, combine, make full, make unique, make valid, expand variables, etc.
member.remarks: Also you can use .NET class . In the past it was too limited and unsafe to use, for example no long paths, too many exceptions. Later improved, but this class still has something it doesn't.

member.name: M:Au.APath.Expand(System.String)
member.summary: If path starts with "%" or "\"%", expands environment variables enclosed in %, else just returns path. Also supports known folder names, like "%AFolders.Documents%". More info in Remarks.
member.param: Any string. Can be null.
member.remarks:
Supports known folder names. See . Example: @"%AFolders.Documents%\file.txt". Example: @"%AFolders.Virtual.ControlPanel%" //gets ":: ITEMIDLIST". Usually known folders are used like string path = AFolders.Documents + "file.txt". However it cannot be used when you want to store paths in text files, registry, etc. Then this feature is useful. To get known folder path, this function calls .
This function is called by many functions of classes APath, AFile, AIcon, some others, therefore all they support environment variables and known folders in path string.

member.name: M:Au.APath.IsFullPath(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if the string is full path, like @"C:\a\b.txt" or @"C:" or @"\\server\share\...":
member.param: Any string. Can be null.
member.remarks:
Returns true if path matches one of these wildcard patterns: - @"?:\*" - local path, like @"C:\a\b.txt". Here ? is A-Z, a-z. - @"?:" - drive name, like @"C:". Here ? is A-Z, a-z. - @"\\*" - network path, like @"\\server\share\...". Or has prefix @"\\?\".
Supports '/' characters too.
Supports only file-system paths. Returns false if path is URL () or starts with "::".
If path starts with "%environmentVariable%", shows warning and returns false. You should at first expand environment variables with or instead use .

member.name: M:Au.APath.IsFullPathExpand(System.String@)
member.summary: Expands environment variables and calls . Returns true if the string is full path, like @"C:\a\b.txt" or @"C:" or @"\\server\share\...":
member.param: Any string. Can be null. If starts with '%' character, calls with expanded environment variables (). If it returns true, replaces the passed variable with the expanded path string.
member.remarks: Returns true if path matches one of these wildcard patterns: - @"?:\*" - local path, like @"C:\a\b.txt". Here ? is A-Z, a-z. - @"?:" - drive name, like @"C:". Here ? is A-Z, a-z. - @"\\*" - network path, like @"\\server\share\...". Or has prefix @"\\?\". Supports '/' characters too. Supports only file-system paths. Returns false if path is URL () or starts with "::".

member.name: M:Au.APath.GetRootLength(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the length of the drive or network folder part in path, including its separator if any. If the string does not start with a drive or network folder path, returns 0 or prefix length (@"\\?\" or @"\\?\UNC\").
member.param: Full path or any string. Can be null. Should not be @"%environmentVariable%\...".
member.remarks: Supports prefixes @"\\?\" and @"\\?\UNC\". Supports separators '\\' and '/'.

member.name: M:Au.APath.GetUrlProtocolLength(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the length of the URL protocol name (also known as URI scheme) in string, including ':'. If the string does not start with a protocol name, returns 0.
member.param: A URL or path or any string. Can be null.
member.remarks:
URL examples: "http:" (returns 5), "http://www.x.com" (returns 5), "file:///path" (returns 5), "shell:etc" (returns 6).
The protocol can be unknown. The function just checks string format, which is an ASCII alpha character followed by one or more ASCII alpha-numeric, '.', '-', '+' characters, followed by ':' character.

member.name: M:Au.APath.IsUrl(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if the string starts with a URL protocol name (existing or not) and ':' character. Calls and returns true if it's not 0.
member.param: A URL or path or any string. Can be null.
member.remarks: URL examples: "http:", "http://www.x.com", "file:///path", "shell:etc".

member.name: M:Au.APath.Combine(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Combines two path parts using character '\\'. For example directory path and file name.
member.param: First part. Usually a directory.
Second part. Usually a filename or relative path.
s2 can be full path. If it is, ignore s1 and return s2 with expanded environment variables. If false (default), simply combines s1 and s2.
Call which may prepend @"\\?\" if the result path is very long. Default true.
member.remarks: If s1 and s2 are null or "", returns "". Else if s1 is null or "", returns s2. Else if s2 is null or "", returns s1. Does not expand environment variables. For it use before, or instead. Path that starts with an environment variable here is considerd not full path. Similar to . Main differences: has some options; supports null arguments.

member.name: M:Au.APath.Combine_(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Combines two path parts. Unlike , fails if some part is empty or @"\" or if s2 is @"\\". Also does not check s2 full path. If fails, throws exception or returns null (if noException).

member.name: M:Au.APath.IsSepChar_(System.Char)
member.summary: Returns true if character c == '\\' || c == '/'.

member.name: M:Au.APath._EndsWithDriveWithoutSep(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns true if ends with ':' preceded by a drive letter, like "C:" or "more\C:", but not like "moreC:".
member.param: Can be null.
Use when want to check drive at a middle, not at the end. Eg returns true if s is @"C:\more" and length is 2.

member.name: M:Au.APath._AddRemoveSep(System.String)
member.summary: Ensures that s either ends with a valid drive path (eg @"C:\" but not "C:") or does not end with '\\' or '/' (unless would become empty if removed).
member.param: Can be null.

member.name: M:Au.APath.Normalize(System.String,System.String,Au.Types.PNFlags)
member.summary: Makes normal full path from path that can contain special substrings etc.
member.param: Any path.
If path is not full path, combine it with defaultParentDirectory to make full path.
member.exception: path is not full path, and defaultParentDirectory is not used or does not make it full path.
member.remarks:
The sequence of actions: 1. If path starts with '%' character, expands environment variables and special folder names. See . 2. If path is not full path but looks like URL, and used flag CanBeUrl, returns path. 3. If path is not full path, and defaultParentDirectory is not null/"", combines path with Expand(defaultParentDirectory). 4. If path is not full path, throws exception. 5. Calls API GetFullPathName. It replaces '/' with '\\', replaces multiple '\\' with single (where need), processes @"\.." etc, trims spaces, etc. 6. If no flag DontExpandDosPath, if path looks like a short DOS path version (contains '~' etc), calls API GetLongPathName. It converts short DOS path to normal path, if possible, for example @"c:\progra~1" to @"c:\program files". It is slow. It converts path only if the file exists. 7. If no flag DontRemoveEndSeparator, removes '\\' character at the end, unless it is like @"C:\". 8. Appends '\\' character if ends with a drive name (eg "C:" -> @"C:\"). 9. If no flag DontPrefixLongPath, calls , which adds @"\\?\" etc prefix if path is very long.
Similar to . Main differences: this function expands environment variables, does not support relative paths, trims '\\' at the end if need.

member.name: M:Au.APath.Normalize_(System.String,Au.Types.PNFlags,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Same as , but skips full-path checking. s should be full path. If not full and not null/"", combines with current directory.

member.name: M:Au.APath.NormalizeMinimally_(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Prepares path for passing to API that support "..", DOS path etc. Calls Expand, _AddRemoveSep, PrefixLongPathIfNeed. Optionally throws if !IsFullPath(path).
member.exception: Not full path (only if throwIfNotFullPath is true).

member.name: M:Au.APath.NormalizeForNET_(System.String)
member.summary: Prepares path for passing to .NET file functions. Calls Expand, _AddRemoveSep. Throws if !IsFullPath(path).

member.name: M:Au.APath.ExpandDosPath_(System.String)
member.summary: Calls API GetLongPathName. Does not check whether s contains '~' character etc. Note: the API is slow.
member.param: Can be null.

member.summary: If path is full path (see ) and does not start with @"\\?\", prepends @"\\?\". If path is network path (like @"\\computer\folder\..."), makes like @"\\?\UNC\computer\folder\...".
member.param: Path. Can be null. Must not start with "%environmentVariable%". This function does not expand it. See .
member.remarks: Windows API kernel functions support extended-length paths, ie longer than 259 characters. But the path must have this prefix. Windows API shell functions don't support it.

member.name: F:Au.APath.MaxFilePathLength
member.summary: Maximal file (not directory) path length supported by all functions (native, .NET and this library). For longer paths need @"\\?\" prefix. It is supported by: most native kernel API (but not shell API), most functions of this library, some .NET functions.

member.name: M:Au.APath.CorrectName(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Replaces characters that cannot be used in file names.
member.param: Initial filename.
A string that will replace each invalid character. Default "-".
member.remarks: Also corrects other forms of invalid or problematic filename: trims spaces and other blank characters; replaces "." at the end; prepends "@" if a reserved name like "CON" or "CON.txt"; returns "-" if name is null/empty/whitespace. Usually returns valid filename, however it can be too long (itself or when combined with a directory path).

member.name: M:Au.APath.GetName(System.String)
member.summary: Gets filename from path. Does not remove extension. Returns "" if there is no filename. Returns null if path is null.
member.param: Path or filename. Can be null.
member.remarks:
Similar to . Some differences: if ends with '\\' or '/', gets part before it, eg "B" from @"C:\A\B\".
Supports separators '\\' and '/'. Also supports URL and shell parsing names like @"::{CLSID-1}\0\::{CLSID-2}".
Examples:
| path | result | - | - | @"C:\A\B\file.txt" | "file.txt" | "file.txt" | "file.txt" | "file" | "file" | @"C:\A\B" | "B" | @"C:\A\B\" | "B" | @"C:\A\/B\/" | "B" | @"C:\" | "" | @"C:" | "" | @"\\network\share" | "share" | @"C:\aa\file.txt:alt.stream" | "file.txt:alt.stream" | "http://a.b.c" | "a.b.c" | "::{A}\::{B}" | "::{B}" | "" | "" | null | null

member.param: Path or filename (then just removes extension). Can be null.
member.remarks:
The same as , just removes extension. Similar to . Some differences: if ends with '\\' or '/', gets part before it, eg "B" from @"C:\A\B\".
Supports separators '\\' and '/'. Also supports URL and shell parsing names like @"::{CLSID-1}\0\::{CLSID-2}".
Examples:
| path | result | - | - | @"C:\A\B\file.txt" | "file" | "file.txt" | "file" | "file" | "file" | @"C:\A\B" | "B" | @"C:\A\B\" | "B" | @"C:\A\B.B\" | "B.B" | @"C:\aa\file.txt:alt.stream" | "file.txt:alt" | "http://a.b.c" | "a.b"

Examples:

member.name: T:Au.AProcessMemory
member.summary: Allocates, writes and reads memory in other process.
member.remarks: Must be disposed. Example: using(var pm=new AProcessMemory(...)) { ... }.

member.name: P:Au.AProcessMemory.ProcessHandle
member.summary: Process handle. Opened with access PROCESS_VM_OPERATION | PROCESS_VM_READ | PROCESS_VM_WRITE.

member.name: P:Au.AProcessMemory.Mem
member.summary: Address of memory allocated in that process.
member.remarks: The address is invalid in this process.

member.name: M:Au.AProcessMemory.SetMem(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets an address of memory in that process that is to be used by the read and write functions.
member.param: A memory address in that process.

Let the Dispose method (or finalizer) call API VirtualFreeEx to free mem. The memory must be allocated with API VirtualAllocEx (by any process) or VirtualAlloc (by that process). If false, mem can be any memory in that process, and this variable will not free it. Alternatively you can use and .
member.exception: This variable already has Mem, unless it was set by this function with freeWhenDisposing = false.
member.remarks: This function can be used if this variable was created with nBytes = 0. Else exception. Also exception if this function previously called with freeWhenDisposing = true.

member.name: M:Au.AProcessMemory.#ctor(Au.AWnd,System.Int32)
member.summary: Opens window's process handle and optionally allocates memory in that process.
member.param: A window in that process.
If not 0, allocates this number of bytes of memory in that process.
member.remarks: This is the preferred constructor when the process has windows. It works with windows of [](xref:uac) High integrity level when this process is Medium+uiAccess.
member.exception: Failed to open process handle (usually because of UAC) or allocate memory.

member.name: M:Au.AProcessMemory.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Opens window's process handle and optionally allocates memory in that process.
member.param: Process id.
If not 0, allocates this number of bytes of memory in that process.
member.exception: Failed to open process handle (usually because of [](xref:uac)) or allocate memory.

member.name: M:Au.AProcessMemory.WriteUnicodeString(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies a string from this process to the memory allocated in that process by the constructor. In that process the string is written as '\0'-terminated UTF-16 string. For it is used (s.Length+1)*2 bytes of memory in that process (+1 for the '\0', *2 because UTF-16 character size is 2 bytes). Returns false if fails.
member.param: A string in this process.
Offset in the memory allocated by the constructor.

member.name: M:Au.AProcessMemory.WriteAnsiString(System.String,System.Int32,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Copies a string from this process to the memory allocated in that process by the constructor. In that process the string is written as '\0'-terminated ANSI string, in default or specified encoding. Returns false if fails.
member.param: A string in this process. Normal C# string (UTF-16), not ANSI.
Offset in the memory allocated by the constructor.
If null, uses system default ANSI encoding.

member.name: M:Au.AProcessMemory.ReadUnicodeString(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Copies a string from the memory in that process allocated by the constructor to this process. Returns the copied string, or null if fails. In that process the string must be in Unicode UTF-16 format (ie not ANSI).
member.param: Number of characters to copy, not including the terminating '\0'. In both processes a character is 2 bytes.
Offset in the memory allocated by the constructor.
Find true string length by searching for '\0' character in nChars range. If false, the returned string is of nChars length even if contains '\0' characters.

member.name: M:Au.AProcessMemory.ReadAnsiString(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Copies a string from the memory in that process allocated by the constructor to this process. Returns the copies string, or null if fails. In that process the string must be in ANSI format (ie not Unicode UTF-16).
member.param: Number bytes to copy, not including the terminating '\0'. In that process a character is 1 or more bytes (depending on encoding). In this process will be 2 bytes (normal C# string).
Offset in the memory allocated by the constructor.
Find true string length by searching for '\0' character in nBytes range of the ANSI string.
If null, uses system default ANSI encoding.

member.name: T:Au.ARun
member.summary: Contains static functions to execute or open programs, other files, folders, web pages, etc.

member.name: M:Au.ARun.Run(System.String,System.String,Au.Types.RFlags,Au.Types.ROptions)
member.summary: Runs/opens a program, document, directory (folder), URL, new email, Control Panel item etc. The returned variable contains some process info - process id etc.
member.param: Examples: - @"C:\file.txt" - AFolders.Documents - AFolders.System + "notepad.exe" - @"%AFolders.System%\notepad.exe" - @"%TMP%\file.txt" - "notepad.exe" - @"..\folder\x.exe" - "http://a.b.c/d" - "file:///path" - "mailto:a@b.c" - ":: ITEMIDLIST" - @"::{CLSID}" - @"shell:AppsFolder\Microsoft.WindowsCalculator_8wekyb3d8bbwe!App". More info in Remarks.
Command line arguments. This function expands environment variables if starts with "%" or "\"%".
Allows to specify more parameters: current directory, verb, etc. If string, it sets initial current directory for the new process. If "", gets it from file. More info: .
member.exception: Used both ROptions.Verb and RFlags.Admin and this process isn't admin.
Failed. For example, the file does not exist.
member.remarks:
It works like when you double-click a file icon. It may start new process or not. For example it may just activate window if the program is already running. Uses API ShellExecuteEx. Similar to .
The file parameter can be: - Full path of a file or directory. Examples: @"C:\file.txt", AFolders.Documents, AFolders.System + "notepad.exe", @"%AFolders.System%\notepad.exe". - Filename of a file or directory, like "notepad.exe". The function calls . - Path relative to . Examples: "x.exe", @"subfolder\x.exe", @".\subfolder\x.exe", @"..\another folder\x.exe". - URL. Examples: "http://a.b.c/d", "file:///path". - Email, like "mailto:a@b.c". Subject, body etc also can be specified, and Google knows how. - Shell object's ITEMIDLIST like ":: ITEMIDLIST". See , . Can be used to open virtual folders and items like Control Panel. - Shell object's parsing name, like @"::{CLSID}". See , . Can be used to open virtual folders and items like Control Panel. - To run a Windows Store App, use @"shell:AppsFolder\WinStoreAppId" format. Examples: @"shell:AppsFolder\Microsoft.WindowsCalculator_8wekyb3d8bbwe!App", @"shell:AppsFolder\windows.immersivecontrolpanel_cw5n1h2txyewy!microsoft.windows.immersivecontrolpanel". To discover the string use or Google.
Supports environment variables, like @"%TMP%\file.txt". See .

member.name: M:Au.ARun.RunSafe(System.String,System.String,Au.Types.RFlags,Au.Types.ROptions)
member.summary: Calls and handles exceptions. All parameters are the same. If Run throws exception, writes it to the output as warning and returns null.
member.remarks: This is useful when you don't care whether Run succeeded and don't want to use try/catch. Handles only exception of type . It is thrown when fails, usually when the file does not exist.

member.name: M:Au.ARun.Console(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Runs a console program, waits until its process ends, and gets its output text. This overload writes text lines to the output in real time.
member.param:
Path or name of an .exe or .bat file. Can be: - Full path. Examples: @"C:\folder\x.exe", AFolders.System + "x.exe", @"%AFolders.System%\x.exe". - Filename, like "x.exe". This function calls . - Path relative to . Examples: "x.exe", @"subfolder\x.exe", @".\subfolder\x.exe", @"..\folder\x.exe".
Supports environment variables, like @"%TMP%\x.bat". See .
null or command line arguments.
Initial current directory of the new process. - If null, uses Directory.GetCurrentDirectory(). - Else if "", calls APath.GetDirectory(exe). - Else calls .
Console's text encoding. If null (default), uses the default console text encoding (API GetOEMCP); it is not Unicode. Programs that display Unicode text use .
member.returns: The process exit code. Usually a non-0 value means error.
member.exception: Failed, for example file not found.
member.remarks:
The console window is hidden. The text that would be displayed in it is redirected to this function.
Console programs have two output text streams - standard output and standard error. This function gets both. Alternatively use . It gets the output and error streams separately, and some lines may be received in incorrect order in time.

member.name: M:Au.ARun.Console(System.Action{System.String},System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Runs a console program, waits until its process ends, and gets its output text. This overload uses a callback function that receives text lines in real time.
member.param: A callback function that receives the output text. It receives single full line at a time, without line break characters.
member.exception: Failed, for example file not found.

member.name: M:Au.ARun.Console(System.String@,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Runs a console program, waits until its process ends, and gets its output text when it ends.
member.param: A variable that receives the output text.
member.exception: Failed, for example file not found.

member.name: T:Au.ASqlite
member.summary: A SQLite database connection. Creates/opens/closes database file or in-memory database. Executes SQL, etc.
member.remarks:
This class wraps a SQLite API object sqlite3* and related sqlite3_x functions. They are documented perfectly in the SQLite website. Uses this unmanaged dll: AFolders.ThisApp + @"64\sqlite3.dll". In 32-bit process - "32" instead of "64".
To correctly close the database file, at first need to dipose all child objects, such as , then dispose the ASqlite object. To dispose a static ASlite variable, you may want to use event. Although this class has a finalizer that disposes the object (closes database), you should always dispose explicitly. Finalizers don't run on process exit.

member.name: M:Au.ASqlite.#ctor(System.String,Au.Types.SLFlags,System.String)
member.summary: Opens or creates a database file.
member.param: Database file. Can be: - Full path. Supports environment variables etc, see - ":memory:" - create a private, temporary in-memory database. - "" - create a private, temporary on-disk database. - Starts with "file:" - see sqlite3_open_v2.
sqlite3_open_v2 flags. Default: read-write, create file if does not exist (and parent directory).

SQL to execute. For example, one or more ;-separated PRAGMA statements to configure the database connection. Or even "CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS ...". This function also always executes "PRAGMA foreign_keys=ON;PRAGMA secure_delete=ON;".
member.exception: Failed to open database or execute sql.
member.remarks: Calls sqlite3_open_v2. If a variable of this class is used by multiple threads, use lock(variable) { } where need.

member.name: M:Au.ASqlite.Dispose
member.summary: Calls sqlite3_close_v2. If fails, writes warning to the output.

SQL statement.
Values that will replace ? characters in sql. Read about SQL parameters in SQLite website. Supported types: . Example: .

member.remarks: The Get(out int, ...) overload also can be used to get uint, short, ushort, byte, sbyte, enum. Will need to cast from int. The Get(out long, ...) overload also can be used to get ulong, 64-bit enum, maybe DateTime. The Get(out double, ...) overload also can be used to get float. Use for other value types - decimal, Guid, Rect, etc.

member.summary: Binds multiple values of any supported types. Returns this.
member.param: Values that will replace ? characters in sql. Read about SQL parameters in SQLite website. Example: . Supported types: - int, uint, byte, sbyte, short, ushort - calls sqlite3_bind_int. - bool - calls sqlite3_bind_int(true?1:0). - long, ulong - calls sqlite3_bind_int64. - double, float - calls sqlite3_bind_double. - string - calls sqlite3_bind_text16. - decimal - calls sqlite3_bind_blob64. - Guid - calls sqlite3_bind_blob64. - byte[] - calls sqlite3_bind_blob64. - An enum type - calls sqlite3_bind_int or sqlite3_bind_int64.
member.exception: A value is of an unsupported type.
member.remarks: For each parameter calls a sqlite3_bind_x function depending on type. Uses index 1, 2 and so on. This function is an alternative to calling BindX functions for each parameter. However it supports less types and adds boxing overhead. Does not call sqlite3_reset and sqlite3_clear_bindings. If need, call before.

member.summary: Returns sqlite3_column_int(column).
member.remarks: Use this function to get integer values of size 4, 2 or 1 bytes: int, uint, short, ushort, byte, sbyte, enum.

member.name: M:Au.ASqliteStatement.GetLong(Au.Types.SLIndexOrName)
member.summary: Returns sqlite3_column_int64(column).
member.remarks: Use this function to get integer values of size 8 bytes: long, ulong, 64-bit enum, maybe DateTime.

member.name: P:Au.AThisProcess.CultureIsInvariant
member.summary: Gets or sets whether and are .
member.remarks: If your app doesn't want to use current culture (default in .NET apps), it can set these properties = or set this property = true. It prevents potential bugs when app/script/components don't specify invariant culture in string functions and 'number to/from string' functions. Also, there is a bug in 'number to/from string' functions in some .NET versions with some cultures: they use wrong minus sign, not ASII '-' which is specified in Control Panel. The default compiler sets this property = true; as well as .

member.name: T:Au.AUac
member.summary: Holds an access token (security info) of a process and provides various security info, eg [](xref:uac) integrity level.

member.name: P:Au.AUac.UnsafeTokenHandle
member.summary: The access token handle.
member.remarks: The handle is managed by this variable and will be closed when disposing or GC-collecting it. Use where need.

member.name: P:Au.AUac.Failed
member.summary: Returns true if the last called property function failed. Normally it should never fail. Only can fail (then it returns null).

member.name: P:Au.AUac.Elevation
member.summary: Gets the [](xref:uac) elevation type of the process.

member.name: P:Au.AUac.IsUIAccess
member.summary: Returns true if the process has [](xref:uac) uiAccess property. A uiAccess process can access/automate all windows of processes running in the same user session.
member.remarks: Most processes don't have this property. They cannot access/automate windows of higher integrity level (High, System, uiAccess) processes and Windows 8 store apps. For example, cannot send keys and Windows messages. Note: High IL (admin) processes also can have this property, therefore IsUIAccess is not the same as IntegrityLevel==IL.UIAccess ( returns UIAccess only for Medium+uiAccess processes; for High+uiAccess processes it returns High). Some Windows API work slightly differently with uiAccess and non-uiAccess admin processes. This property is rarely useful. Instead use other properties of this class.

member.name: P:Au.AUac.IntegrityLevel
member.summary: Gets the [](xref:uac) integrity level (IL) of the process.
member.remarks: IL from lowest to highest value: Untrusted, Low, Medium, UIAccess, High, System, Protected, Unknown. The IL enum member values can be used like if(x.IntegrityLevel > IL.Medium) ... . If UAC is turned off, most non-service processes on administrator account have High IL; on non-administrator - Medium.

member.name: M:Au.AUac.OfProcess(System.Int32)
member.summary: Opens process access token and creates/returns new variable that holds it. Then you can use its properties. Returns null if failed. For example fails for services and some other processes if current process is not administrator.
member.param: Process id. If you have a window, use .
member.remarks: To get AUac of this process, use .

member.summary: Gets variable for this process.

member.summary: Returns true if [](xref:uac) is disabled (turned off) completely (not just disabled UAC consent screeen/dialog).
