member.name: M:Au.AWnd.MenuClick(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Posts a "menu item clicked" notification (WM_COMMAND) as if that menu item was clicked. Does not use the mouse.
member.param: Menu item id. Must be in range 1 to 0xffff.
The menu item is in the title bar's context menu, not in the menu bar. Posts WM_SYSCOMMAND instead.
member.remarks: Works only with standard (classic) menus. The drop-down menu window class name must be "#32768". Works with menu items in window menu bar, system menu and some context menus. Does not use the menu itself. Just posts WM_COMMAND or WM_SYSCOMMAND message. Even if a menu item with this id does not exist. This variable is the window that contains the menu bar or system menu. Or the drop-down menu window (class "#32768") that contains the menu item.

member.name: T:Au.AWnd.Finder
member.summary: Contains top-level window properties and can be used to find the window.

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.Finder.Props
member.summary: Parsed parameter values. All read-only.

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.Finder.TProps.DoesNotMatch
member.summary: After unsuccesful indicates the parameter that does not match.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.Finder.#ctor(System.String,System.String,Au.Types.WOwner,Au.Types.WFlags,System.Func{Au.AWnd,System.Boolean},Au.Types.WContains)
member.summary: See .

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.Finder.op_Implicit(System.String)~Au.AWnd.Finder
member.summary: Implicit conversion from string that can contain window name, class name, program and/or a contains object. Examples: "name,cn,program", "name", ",cn", ",,program", "name,cn", "name,,program", ",cn,program", "name,,,object".
member.param: One or more comma-separated window properties: name, class, program and/or a contains object. Empty parts are considered null. The same as parameters of . The first 3 parts are name, cn and of. The last part is contains as string; can specify an accessible object, control or image. The first 3 comma-separated parts cannot contain commas. Alternatively, parts can be separated by '\0' characters, like "name\0"+"cn\0"+"program\0"+"object". Then parts can contain commas. Example: "*one, two, three*\0" (name with commas).
member.exception: If specifies a contains object: exceptions of constructor of or or .

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.Finder.Result
member.summary: The found window.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.Finder.Find
member.summary: Finds the specified window, like . Returns true if found. The property will be the window.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.Finder.FindInList(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Au.AWnd})
member.summary: Finds the specified window in a list of windows. Returns 0-based index, or -1 if not found. The property will be the window.
member.param: Array or list of windows, for example returned by .

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.Finder.FindAll
member.summary: Finds all matching windows, like . Returns array containing 0 or more window handles as AWnd.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.Finder.FindAllInList(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Au.AWnd})
member.summary: Finds all matching windows in a list of windows. Returns array containing 0 or more window handles as AWnd.
member.param: Array or list of windows, for example returned by .

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.Finder._FindOrMatch(Au.AWnd._WndList,System.Action{Au.AWnd},Au.Types.WFCache)
member.summary: Returns index of matching element or -1. Returns -1 if using getAll.
member.param: List of AWnd. Does not dispose it.
If not null, calls it for all matching and returns -1.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.Finder.IsMatch(Au.AWnd,Au.Types.WFCache)
member.summary: Returns true if window w properties match the specified properties.
member.param: A top-level window. If 0 or invalid, returns false.
Can be used to make faster when multiple Finder variables are used with same window. The function gets window name/class/program once, and stores in cache; next time it gets these strings from cache.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.Find(System.String,System.String,Au.Types.WOwner,Au.Types.WFlags,System.Func{Au.AWnd,System.Boolean},Au.Types.WContains)
member.summary: Finds a top-level window and returns its handle as AWnd.
member.returns: Returns default(AWnd) if not found. See also: , .
member.param: Window name. Usually it is the title bar text. String format: [](xref:wildcard_expression). null means 'can be any'. "" means 'no name'.
Window class name. String format: [](xref:wildcard_expression). null means 'can be any'. Cannot be "".

Program file name, like "notepad.exe". String format: [](xref:wildcard_expression). null means 'can be any'. Cannot be "". Cannot be path.
Or (process id), (thread id), (owner window). See , , , , .

Callback function. Called for each matching window. It can evaluate more properties of the window and return true when they match. Example: also: t => !t.IsPopupWindow. Called after evaluating all other parameters except contains.

Defines an object that must be in the client area of the window: - Accessible object: or string like "name" or "a 'role' name" or "a 'role'". - Child control: or string like "c 'cn' name" or "c '' name" or "c 'cn'". - Image(s) or color(s): or string "image:..." (uses AWinImage.Find with flag ).
member.remarks:
To create code for this function, use dialog "Find window or control".
If there are multiple matching windows, gets the first in the Z order matching window, preferring visible windows.
On Windows 8 and later may skip Windows Store app Metro-style windows (on Windows 10 few such windows exist). It happens if this program does not have disableWindowFiltering true in its manifest and is not uiAccess; to find such windows you can use .
To find message-only windows use instead.
member.exception: - cn is "". To match any, use null. - of is "" or 0 or contains character \ or /. To match any, use null. - Invalid wildcard expression ("**options " or regular expression).

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.FindAll(System.String,System.String,Au.Types.WOwner,Au.Types.WFlags,System.Func{Au.AWnd,System.Boolean},Au.Types.WContains)
member.summary: Finds all matching windows. Returns array containing 0 or more window handles as AWnd. Parameters etc are the same as .
member.remarks: The list is sorted to match the Z order, however hidden windows (when using ) are always after visible windows.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.FindFast(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,Au.AWnd)
member.summary: Finds a top-level window and returns its handle as AWnd.
member.returns: Returns default(AWnd) if not found. See also: , .
member.param: Name. Full, case-insensitive. Wildcard etc not supported. null means 'can be any'. "" means 'no name'.
Class name. Full, case-insensitive. Wildcard etc not supported. null means 'can be any'. Cannot be "".
Search only message-only windows.
If used, starts searching from the next window in the Z order.
member.remarks: Calls API FindWindowEx. Faster than , which uses API EnumWindows. Finds hidden windows too. Supports . It is not recommended to use this function in a loop to enumerate windows. It would be unreliable because window positions in the Z order can be changed while enumerating. Also then it would be slower than Find and FindAll.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.FindFastCached_(System.Int64@,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Calls , sets this and time, but only if !IsAlive or more than 1 s elapsed since that. Returns this.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.FindOrRun(System.String,System.String,Au.Types.WOwner,Au.Types.WFlags,System.Func{Au.AWnd,System.Boolean},Au.Types.WContains,System.Action,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Finds a top-level window (calls ). If found, activates (optionally), else calls callback function and waits for the window. The callback should open the window, for example call . Returns window handle as AWnd. Returns default(AWnd) if not found (if runWaitS is negative; else exception).
member.param: See .
See .
See .
See .
See .
See .
Callback function. See example.
How long to wait for the window after calling the callback function. Seconds. Default 60. See .
Finally the window must be active. Default: true.
member.exception: runWaitS time has expired. Not thrown if runWaitS <= 0.

example.code: AWnd w = AWnd.FindOrRun("* Notepad", run: () => ARun.Run("notepad.exe")); AOutput.Write(w);

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.IsMatch(System.String,System.String,Au.Types.WOwner,Au.Types.WFlags,System.Func{Au.AWnd,System.Boolean},Au.Types.WContains)
member.summary: Compares window name and other properties like does. Returns true if all specified (non-null/default) properties match.
member.param: See .
See .
See .
See .
See .
See .
member.remarks: Creates new and calls . To compare single parameter, use more lightweight code. Examples: if (w.Name.Like("* Notepad")), if (w.ClassNameIs("CabinetWClass")).

member.name: T:Au.AWnd._WndList
member.summary: An enumerable list of AWnd for and . Holds ArrayBuilder_ or IEnumerator or single AWnd or none. Must be disposed if it is ArrayBuilder_ or IEnumerator, else disposing is optional.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.FromXY(Au.Types.POINT,Au.Types.WXYFlags)
member.summary: Gets visible top-level window or control from point.
member.param: Coordinates. Tip: To specify coordinates relative to the right, bottom, work area or a non-primary screen, use , like in the example.
member.remarks: Unlike API WindowFromPhysicalPoint etc, this function: does not skip disabled controls; always skips transparent control like group box if a smaller sibling is there. All this is not true with flag Raw.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.FromMouse(Au.Types.WXYFlags)
member.summary: Gets visible top-level window or control from mouse cursor position. More info: .

member.param: X coordinate in client area or screen (if flag ScreenXY). Can be etc.
Y coordinate.
member.exception: This variable is invalid (window not found, closed, etc).

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.ChildFromXY(Au.Types.POINT,Au.Types.WXYCFlags)
member.summary: Gets descendant control from point. By default returns default(AWnd) if the point is not in a child control; it depends on flags.
member.param: Coordinates in client area or screen (if flag ScreenXY).
member.exception: This variable is invalid (window not found, closed, etc).

member.name: M:Au.AWnd._FromXY(Au.Types.POINT,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Gets window or control from point. Returns default(AWnd) if failed (unlikely).
member.param: Point in screen.
Receives true if control, false if top-level or failed.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd._ChildFromXY(Au.Types.POINT,Au.Types.WXYCFlags)
member.summary: Gets descendant control from point. This can be top-level window or control. If there is no descendant, the return value depends on flags.
member.param: Point in client area or screen (if flag ScreenXY).

member.name: M:Au.AWnd._SiblingXY(Au.AWnd._SibXY,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets sibling control in space: left, right, above or below. Returns default(AWnd) if there is no sibling.
member.param: Distance from this control (from its edge) in the specified direction.

Distance in perpendicular direction, along the specified edge. Default 5. If direction is Left or Right, 0 is the top edge, 1 is 1 pixel down, -1 is 1 pixel up, and so on. If direction is Above or Below, 0 is the left edge, 1 is 1 pixel to the right, -1 is 1 pixel to the left, and so on.
If at that point is a visible child or descendant of the sibling, get that child/descendant. Default false.
member.exception: This variable is invalid (window not found, closed, etc).
member.remarks: This function is used mostly with controls, but supports top-level windows too.

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.Get
member.summary: Gets related windows and controls. Use like AWnd w2 = w1.Get.Owner; (here w1 is an AWnd variable).

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.SwitchActiveWindow
member.summary: Activates next non-minimized main window, like with Alt+Tab. Returns true if activated, false if there is no such window or failed to activate.
member.remarks: Uses , , . An alternative way - send Alt+Tab keys, but it works not everywhere.

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.OwnerWindow
member.summary: Gets or sets the owner window of this top-level window.
member.remarks: A window that has an owner window is always on top of it. Don't call this for controls, they don't have an owner window. The 'get' function returns default(AWnd) if this window isn't owned or is invalid. Supports . The 'set' function can fail, eg if the owner's process has higher [](xref:uac) integrity level or is a Store app.

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.Window
member.summary: Gets the top-level parent window of this control. If this is a top-level window, returns this. Returns default(AWnd) if this window is invalid.
member.remarks: Supports .

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.IsChild
member.summary: Returns true if this is a child window (control), false if top-level window.
member.remarks: Supports . Another way is w.HasStyle(WS.CHILD). It is faster but less reliable, because some top-level windows have WS_CHILD style and some child windows don't.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.IsChildOf(Au.AWnd)
member.summary: Returns true if this is a child or descendant of window w.
member.remarks: Calls API IsChild. Supports .

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.ParentGWL_
member.summary: Returns (AWnd)GetWindowLong(GWL.HWNDPARENT).

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.Active
member.summary: Gets the active (foreground) window. Calls API GetForegroundWindow. Returns default(AWnd) if there is no active window; more info: .

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.IsActive
member.summary: Returns true if this window is the active (foreground) window.

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.IsActiveOrNoActiveAndThisIsWndRoot_
member.summary: Returns true if this window is the active (foreground) window. If this is , returns true if there is no active window.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.SetTransparency(System.Boolean,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{Au.Types.ColorInt})
member.summary: Sets opacity and/or transparent color.
member.param: Set or remove WS_EX_LAYERED style that is required for transparency. If false, other parameters are not used.
Opacity from 0 (completely transparent) to 255 (opaque). Does not change if null. If less than 0 or greater than 255, makes 0 or 255.
Make pixels of this color completely transparent. Does not change if null. The alpha byte is not used.
member.remarks: Uses API SetLayeredWindowAttributes. On Windows 7 works only with top-level windows, on newer OS also with controls. Does not work with WPF windows, class name "HwndWrapper*".

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.IsFullScreen
member.summary: Returns true if this is a full-screen window and not desktop.

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.IsOfShellThread_
member.summary: Returns true if this belongs to GetShellWindow's thread (usually it is the desktop window).

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.IsOfShellProcess_
member.summary: Returns true if this belongs to GetShellWindow's process (eg a folder window, desktop, taskbar).

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.IsWindows8MetroStyle
member.summary: Returns true if this window has Metro style, ie is not a classic desktop window. On Windows 8/8.1 most Windows Store app windows and many shell windows have Metro style. On Windows 10 few windows have Metro style. On Windows 7 there are no Metro style windows.

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.IsUwpApp
member.summary: On Windows 10 and later returns non-zero if this is a UWP app window: 1 if class name is "ApplicationFrameWindow", 2 if "Windows.UI.Core.CoreWindow".

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.MinimalSleepIfOtherThread_
member.summary: if(!IsOfThisThread) { Thread.Sleep(15); SendTimeout(1000, 0); }

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.MinimalSleepNoCheckThread_
member.summary: Thread.Sleep(15); SendTimeout(1000, 0);

member.name: M:Au.AWnd._WindowsStoreAppFrameChild(Au.AWnd)
member.summary: On Win10+, if w is "ApplicationFrameWindow", returns the real app window "Windows.UI.Core.CoreWindow" hosted by w. If w is minimized, cloaked (eg on other desktop) or the app is starting, the "Windows.UI.Core.CoreWindow" is not its child. Then searches for a top-level window named like w. It is unreliable, but MS does not provide API for this. Info: "Windows.UI.Core.CoreWindow" windows hosted by "ApplicationFrameWindow" belong to separate processes. All "ApplicationFrameWindow" windows belong to a single process.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.Wait(System.Double,System.Boolean,System.String,System.String,Au.Types.WOwner,Au.Types.WFlags,System.Func{Au.AWnd,System.Boolean},Au.Types.WContains)
member.summary: Waits until window exists, is visible (optionally) and active (optionally). Returns window handle. On timeout returns default(AWnd) if secondsTimeout is negative; else exception. Parameters etc are the same as .
member.param: Timeout, seconds. Can be 0 (infinite), >0 (exception) or <0 (no exception). More info: [](xref:wait_timeout).
The window must be the active window (), and not minimized.
member.remarks: By default ignores invisible and cloaked windows. Use flags if need. If you have a window's AWnd variable, to wait until it is active/visible/etc use instead.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.WaitAny(System.Double,System.Boolean,Au.AWnd.Finder[])
member.summary: Waits until any of specified windows exists, is visible (optionally) and active (optionally). Returns 1-based index and window handle. On timeout returns (0, default(AWnd)) if secondsTimeout is negative; else exception.
member.param: Timeout, seconds. Can be 0 (infinite), >0 (exception) or <0 (no exception). More info: [](xref:wait_timeout).
The window must be the active window (), and not minimized.
One or more variables containing window properties. Can be strings, see .
member.remarks: By default ignores invisible and cloaked windows. Use finder flags if need.

example.code: var (i, w) = AWnd.WaitAny(10, true, "* Notepad", new AWnd.Finder("* Word")); AOutput.Write(i, w);

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.WaitForCondition(System.Double,System.Func{Au.AWnd,System.Boolean},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Waits for a user-defined state/condition of this window. For example active, visible, enabled, closed, contains control.
member.param: Timeout, seconds. Can be 0 (infinite), >0 (exception) or <0 (no exception). More info: [](xref:wait_timeout).
Callback function (eg lambda). It is called repeatedly, until returns true.

Do not throw exception when the window handle is invalid or the window was closed while waiting. In such case the callback function must return false, like in the examples with . Else exception is thrown (with a small delay) to prevent infinite waiting.
member.returns: Returns true. On timeout returns false if secondsTimeout is negative; else exception.
member.exception: The window handle is invalid or the window was closed while waiting.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.WaitForName(System.Double,System.String)
member.summary: Waits until this window has the specified name.
member.param: Timeout, seconds. Can be 0 (infinite), >0 (exception) or <0 (no exception). More info: [](xref:wait_timeout).
Window name. Usually it is the title bar text. String format: [](xref:wildcard_expression).
member.returns: Returns true. On timeout returns false if secondsTimeout is negative; else exception.
member.exception: The window handle is invalid or the window was closed while waiting.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.WaitForClosed(System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Waits until this window is closed/destroyed or until its process ends.
member.param: Timeout, seconds. Can be 0 (infinite), >0 (exception) or <0 (no exception). More info: [](xref:wait_timeout).
Wait until the process of this window ends.
member.returns: Returns true. On timeout returns false if secondsTimeout is negative; else exception.
member.exception: Failed to open process handle when waitUntilProcessEnds is true.
member.remarks: If the window is already closed, immediately returns true.
